label: 石高
本: Terms and Concepts in Japanese Medieval History . Journal of Japanese Studies . 1983
説明文: Officially designated method of assessing a landholding's value in terms of yield by koku of rice, in contrast to cash. The practice dates from Hideyoshi's land surveys of the 1580s; not applicable to the medieval period. See kandaka.　[豊臣秀吉、貫高]
